document.docAuthor: Brescovit, Antonio D., Ruiz, Alexander Sánchez & Garcia, Giraldo Alayón
document.masterDocTitle: The Filistatidae in the Caribbean region, with a description of the new genus Antilloides, revision of the genus Filistatoides F. O. P. - Cambridge and notes on Kukulcania Lehtinen (Arachnida, Araneae)

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: The Filistatidae in the Caribbean region, with a description of the new genus Antilloides, revision of the genus Filistatoides F. O. P. - Cambridge and notes on Kukulcania Lehtinen (Arachnida, Araneae)

subSubSection.paragraph:
Kukulcania hibernalis : Lehtinen, 1967 : 242
, fig. 19 . See World Spider Catalog, 2016 for the full synonymic list.

paragraph.treatmentCitationGroup:
Filistata isolinae
Alayón, 1972
: 7
, pl. III–IV (One female lectotype and female paralectotype , designed in Alayón, 1975 , from San Antonio de los Baños, Artemisa, Cuba ,
25 .VIII. 1970
, G. Alayón col., deposited in MNHNCu, examined). New synonymy .

subSubSection.paragraph:
Note . The type specimens of
Kukulkania isolinae Alayón
are immature and have the same characters as immatures of
K. hibernalis (Hentz)
, a very common species distributed in Cuba .

Diagnosis . Males of
Kukulcania hibernalis
can be distinguished from those of
K. brevipes
, the other species from the Neotropical region, by the less spiny venter of the palpal tibiae and leg I, the cymbium without modified distal setae and the stout, coiled embolus and the medially positioned spermathecae (see
Brescovit & Santos, 2013
: figs 1 D‒F, 2 D‒F, 3 B).

Description . See
Ramírez & Grismado ( 1997 : 348 , figs 1, 4, 7, 107 – 111 )
and
Brescovit & Santos ( 2013 : 311 , figs 1 D‒F, 2 D‒F, 3 B)
.
